metadata.title: CVE-2016-1646 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Array.prototype.concat implementation in builtins.cc in Google V8, asused in Google Chrome before 49.0.2623.108, does not properly considerelement data types, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds read) or possibly have unspecified other impact viacrafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-browser-l10n - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-chromedriver - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.7-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
